description:
Love this place. Super quick + yummy + very reasonably priced. I recommend their hunan salmon over rice and any of their other specials probably but I always get the hunan salmon and it's really good. And! They always manage to get me my take out so fast I can catch the bus home. 

I don't feel bad for anyone who ordered this over delivery. If that's the only way you can eat chinese food you're not doing it right imo.. It's a nice little place and they make the food while you're waiting.
author: LS J.

description:
I am completely happy with my order! The food tasted amazing! Everything was flavorful and a total joy to eat! Not a lot of Chinese restaurants cook broccoli beef god, this one met my standards and surpassed my expectations! The beef was tender, the broccoli had the right combo of crunchy and cooked but not beat to death tender.. the salt and pepper chicken wings had a good crunch to them but not over cooked or solid as rocks like other restaurants. Five stars for me, no doubt! Fast delivery too. I can keep going, but I don't want to make the wife jealous... haha why can't you talk about me the way you talk about food...  

Ps men; just smile and nod, don't ever answer that question if she asks hahaha 

Your pal, fat guy in little coat!
author: Jose P.

description: The food is always good it taste the same. I love to get the buffet cause you have a variety of options to pick from. They always have fried chicken but sometimes they have a sweet and spicy chicken out as well it all depends on what you're in the mood for when you go
author: Kentara W.

description:
Food: weird. Had salt & pepper tofu, spicy broccoli, egg rolls, and beef chow fun. Every dish was weird. Weird ingredient substitutions (awkward noodle choice, cilantro in broccoli dish, wine sauce). 

Service: Not applicable; Eat24 order
author: Shannon H.

description: They delivered to us and the food is amazing!  I ordered the spring rolls and the wonton soup.  Perfect comfort food for working late night!
author: Alexandra S.

description: Just got my order !! Everything I ordered came out wrong! I ordered a vegetarian fried rice, I received a fried rice full of shrimps and bacon which I dont eat, and I ordered chicken noodle , and received vegetarian ones.... well I am really disapointed !
author: Olivia C.

description: Fast n fresh n tasty. Drove in from LA tonight & needed a bite. Delivered 10:45pm totally fresh n just as I ordered. Have ordered from before will again.
author: P C.

description: The food here is good I love the salt and pepper calamari and the sweet-and-sour pork .I did not care For the crab puffs because they use the yellow American cheese instead of cream cheese I haven't had the Wong tong soup yet .the house right rice is good I order from them maybe 2 times a week. They do deliver but could be a little bit faster and they need to start serving crab and garlic noodles then they would be on point the potstickers are also really good
author: Jue'leah W.

description: This neighborhood is a food desert, amongst the plethora of liquor stores and a walgreens. The tomato beef chow mein fried was a tantalizing meal before heading to Juniors for a cocktail. Fixed the hunger pains. The indignant drunk loiterer dry heaving adds to the charm. Forget about that, one realizes your in the Portrero. Don't close anytime soon.
author: Al L.

description:
Seriously... been waiting 35 mins for 2 fried rice dishes. I forgot to mention this was for TAKE AWAY... not dining in at this place. But food to go...  woof... just awful.
Please don't come here. It's utter crap and their service is slow and atrocious.
author: K M.

description:
Terrible! I ordered through the Eat24 app and ordered their "crab wonton" and what I got was friend American cheese!! TF is that?? I called and got my money back. Never again.

Order at your own risk.
author: This Is M E.

description: This is a good place for late night chinese food. They open late and offer delivery. Their service is pretty good too. I got a late night delivery and the staff were very friendly and accommodating. The porridge was decent but had too many big pieces of onion, and the vegetable dumplings were super salty. Might come back for the porridge and service.
author: Jacqui C.

description: Got delivery to bayview. Came on time w correct order. I was putting the kids away and they waiting at door.  Quality food delivered fast
author: Victor T.

description: It was de-luscious！Next time，I will request the pot stickers to be a little under-fried as the edges were a bit on the hard side，but that is probably standard fair.
author: XingFeng C.

description:
So, long story short, I had to use the restroom super bad. Walgreens told me this place would let me use it, come to find out : only if you're a customer. Fine I'll buy something. 5 dollar minimum, I order chicken chow mein and hot and sour soup. 15 bucks later and I get to use a clean bathroom and have dinner.

Was it worth it? For then bathroom yes. The food... eh. Only if you must. Two stars for clean bathroom and friendly service. One star for super good hot n sour soup. Which was a surprise ... chicken chow mein not so much. Will I go back? Probably not unless I have a bathroom emergency again. Sorry but I have cheaper and better chinese closer to my house
author: Rosie S.

description:
I ordered from Wok & Go via Yelp Eat24.

My food arrived late. Like almost two hours late. As for the food? I've had better. For some reason, the dishes tasted really bitter. Like, the veggies they used were old or something. The chow mein noodles were hard, not nearly cooked enough. The fried rice was plain AF  and it basically looked like steam rice with a little bit soy sauce.

 At least I got to try this place out.
author: Robin M.

description: It's hole in the wall. But food should still be fresh. Porridge was spoiled. Can tell by clumps using leftover rice to make it instead of fresh grains. It was sour. Ignored the sour at first but it got worse after each scoop. Stomach is beginning to act up. Other foods were ok.
author: Hyun B.

description:
I like wok and go 's food,very delicious. I  am very
 Like they have delivery. Fast and delicious ,I like the kung Pao chicken,and the salt and pepper chicken wing
author: Christy M.

description: The main perk of Wok & Go is that it's one of the only late night food options in the (south)eastern part of the Mission - and even then it's only 12am, so not really that late (but that's a topic for another day).  The food is pretty standard for a Chinese place, with options including chow mein, fried rice, sweet and sour chicken, and general's spicy chicken.  Portions are pretty sizable, and price is relatively fair.  Overall not my favorite Chinese place, but a decent option for someone looking for late night food around Potrero during the week.
author: Curren I.

description:
This place is like a time machine back to the 90s. Remember that Chinese food restaurant next to the Blockbuster that your parents liked so much? This is the one. Twenty bucks will buy dinner for five people.

They have Sweet and Sour tofu here. That shit is amazing. It tastes as though I may develop insulin resistance. If so, I am better for it. There's so much sauce in there that when I opened the box and some spilled, it looked like someone bled to death in my kitchen. They are not skimpy on the portions. 

I cannot think of a better place to binge eat if you are feeling low. This is the savory food equivalent of eating a whole carton of ice cream. Go nuts, kid.
author: Heather R.

description: The food portions are great, lots of fresh vegetables & huge chunks of chicken in the chicken dishes. Food delivery is always fast & timely.
author: Greg B.

description: A quick and cheap stop for Chinese food, not former by any stretch of the imagination, but also not an awful choice for being in the mission. I ordered the sesame chicken, green beans, and how mein, and was satisfied with the quick service and he food. This is where to come if you are looking for takeout of for a quick and cheap option. You won't be let down, and you won't have your socks blown off.
author: Ross S.

description: I mean, maybe for the price it's alright? I'm sure there must be specific things on the menu that are actually good and worth the buy, so it's likely just a matter of figuring out what they are. But what I ordered started out good and then got very very salty after a few bites.
author: Jen A.

description: I love coming here my favorite chef happy people work her family owned  open late everyday till 12 am delivery close by no msg fast service I ordered tho ric plate substitute steam rice for fried rice Chef make my order special so if you order mongolian chicken it won't have the veggies in it he's been cooking my food for a long time so you always surprise me with something extra
author: Jeannine P.

description:
When I came I ordered ahead of time.I made sure that it was right.This time another mistake.When You clearly say No Purple Onions,that Means Nada,Or just plain No.Im allergic to them.
What's worst is that they took it out and left 2 small ones under the Veggies that came with it.This is totally wrong.No matter what they did the smell of the Purple onions was still there.And worst part they didn't replace My food Order.That means they don't want Our Business
author: Robert C.

description:
This place is consistently delicious and wonderful. The smell is amazing aromas. The food is very good. 
Every time I go there I will try the difficult thing. I tried Singapore Fried Rice Noodle, Shrimp Fried Rice, Walnut Prawns, etc. 
I have been this restaurant two years. I still trying different things. Every thing I tried is very good. 
I love this restaurant, I will still here.
author: Jenny N.

description:
Wok & Go has many alluring qualities. It's a quick 5 minute walk from my apartment. It's open late. It has large portions. It has an intriguing dirty exterior that hints of possible tasty meals inside. Alas, the potential is unfulfilled. 

Tip #1: W&G is open relatively late - 11:45 every day. BUT. El Farolito is also open late - 1:30 or 2:30am every day - and it's just a few blocks away.

Tip #2: The portions are large and filling. Wok & Go provides a lot of rice, meat, and veggies for the price, so it's definitely a good deal. 

Overall: Although the food-to-price ratio is great, I'm not a big fan of their food. I've found myself going to Walgreens across the street for a quick meal instead of Wok & Go.
author: Sarah W.

description: I never leave bad reviews. We ordered here on uber eats. Literally not able to eat this food. It's so bad. Save yourself the pain. Everything tastes terrible- in trash.
author: Dominic C.

description:
I went on New Years Day and was pleasantly surprised to find this place open. I walked in and the cafeteria-style stations were not running (probably because of the holiday). I ordered the Kung Pao Tofu with Mixed Vegetables and a Coke (to stay awake). Food came out quickly and was okay. Definitely not great but passable. I was the only person in the restaurant around 5:30pm and it took about 15 minutes for the food to come out. 

Pros:
Located next to San Francisco General Hospital. 
Open at random times.
Decent price for amount of food

Cons:
Rice is extra if you order an entree. 

Tips:
They speak Mandarin
author: David Y.

description: It was our first time trying them!!! We ordered won ton soup! It was delicious and still hot when it got delivered!! We will order again from this place!
author: Linda M.

description:
Service-0

Not Wok and Go. It should be Walk and keep running!  Or Wok and Wait!

Staying at a AirBnB that's real close. Tried this local place. Service is terrible! Gal at the counter took our order then took a phone order before submitting our order. She was on the phone for about 15 minutes, trying to get the order before turning in our order. They kept going back and forth. Locals and out of towner's deserve better service. 

Food-3

Shrimp Shumai - not sure what possessed me to order that, but again Wok and keep running on this dish!

Braised beef, eggplant and basil - not bad

Bok Choy and garlic - I'd order that again.
author: Ron K.

description:
I am pregnant and I was waiting for my food my food arrived I was about to eat the pot sticker that I orders and found strands of hair called Grubhub where I ordered my food and they certainly didn't help at all definitely not ordering from this unsanitary place ever want to
Inspect the food to make sure I wasn't lying I would never waste my time.
author: Michelle V.

description:
My food was an hour late. When I called to inquire about it, the lady hung up on me. 

The delivery guy said he's the only one delivering food. Poor dude is probably getting bitched at for something that isn't even his fault. 

The management need to fix that, lastly my fried bananas are so dry and hard they're not even edible -__- such a waste of $7!
author: Jelyn G.

description: I came to check it out on my lunch break and I should've went with my gut when I saw the entrees that didn't look as.......robust as a fresh cooked meal. But I was hungry and worked to the bone and needed sustenance so I gave it a chance I had the fried rice with some kind of curry chicken and mushroom chicken. It wasn't inedible...........but it made my mouth sad with each bite. I took a few more bites just to get something in my body but took the rest to go now some homeless person will have a meal.
author: Ali L.

description: Food was very good,fresh,tasty.Delivery was fast,driver as nice, we were very happy they had late night delivery service , unfortunately no fortune cookies.
author: Kingli K.

description: The chow mein did not have a good flavor. I asked for some vegetable chow mein and they only put like 3 broccoli pieces!! Not a good place for chow mein!!!
author: Ivonne V.

description: Best seasame chicken and combo fried rice I ever had in SF. And having a really great deal less than $10 with cheap price and large size food. Will come always.
author: Noah C.

description: Hosting late night parties for kids. Just when you needed late night munchies. This place delivers fast and food is still hot. Great food for last minute ideas.
author: Rudy D.

description: Their spicy chicken wings are awesome! My wife gets the sesame chicken and I get the General Tso chicken with lo mein noodles.  If their phone is ringing and they're busy, they take the phone off the hook, so sometimes you need to call repeatedly before they answer.
author: Jon F.

description:
ordered a delivery today
ask for extra money for rice？
unbelievable
the price is high and the beef is not fresh
author: 源

description: This place is awesome, fresh cook, also delivery fast,7.99 for two items, love it, will  definitely come back again.
author: Daniel C.

description: Terrifyingly bad wonton soup. Restaurant didn't get the order right (I wanted wonton noodle soup - no noodles arrived) and delivery driver was quite rude. Ewww to tendon-y wonton... *blech*
author: Mithuna S.

description: This is my favorite place for eating out.The place is clean and comfortable.The staff are polite and nice. My friends referred me this restaurants. I like the place and the food very much. The food is like homemade, delicious,and nutritious. Also, the price is cheaper compared to other restaurants. Now I eat there weekly with my friends. They like the food there too. Recently, I had family party and ordered green bean chicken, beef broccoli, roast duck, general shao chicken, and egg roll from Wok and Go. My families and friends enjoyed the food and asked me for thos restaurant information....I am happy to share my favorite. Restaurant with you and highly recommend Wok And Go to you,,
author: Wendy W.

description:
Room. For. Improvement. 

There is something to be said about the presence of a "Chinese" restaurant located in the most unexpected places. However, with this in mind, Wok & Go is located in a corner that favors good foot traffic, potential for good business [if they know how to harness], and convenient to a well known county hospital, Zuckerberg San Francisco General. 

The restaurant is set up for point, pack, and go dish items. Recommendation; go early when the entrees are fresh and well presented. Restaurant workers tend to get frazzled when there are more people than they can serve. Don't bother calling in orders; the last two experiences reflect that they are unreliable in mere order taking. Visuals at the restaurant works best. 

Would I go back? yes and no. The food choices are typical Americanized Chinese dishes; i.e. beef broccoli. Reasonable prices. But for someone who works in the area; it's okay. The restaurant needs to be more attentive and consistent with service and food choices.
author: Edgar M.

description: I was pretty hungry, at this place was convenient, relative to where I was working.  The lady working the counter was very nice.  I decided on the two entrees and one side.  For my side I chose fried rice.  For my two entrees, I ended up going with the curry chicken and tofu.  The fried rice tasted average.  It was seasoned well.  The curry chicken was very good.  The potatoes were soft and the curry and chicken were delicious.  The tofu was so spicy, but so good.  I appreciate that they offer chili oil.  Sometimes sriracha just does not cut it.  It was a good meal, and I will be back.
author: Victor L.

description:
I've ordered delivery from Wok & Go through Eat24 two times, both times for the porridge, since I've been suffering from a cold. At this time, there aren't very many restaurants on Eat24 that offer porridge.

My first order was on Monday for lunch, and the food was delivered within the expected window of time. I ordered only two items, just enough to fulfill the minimum for delivery. I got the Fish Porridge and the Chicken Salad. The porridge was exactly what I wanted. It was plain but flavorful enough, with nice soft chunks of fish and rice. The chicken salad was disappointing. There was way too much white, creamy dressing, rendering the salad a soggy mess. The chicken pieces were breaded (fried). I was hoping for a healthy salad, and this one was NOT that, by any means.

My second order was on Wednesday for dinner, and the food was delivered almost an hour after the expected delivery time, two hours after the order was placed. The original Eat24 delivery time estimate was 45-60 minutes. I'm not sure whether the fault lies more on Eat24 on getting the delivery time estimate wrong or with the restaurant for not delivering within the expected timeframe. When the bag of food arrived, much of the sauce for the Ma Po Tofu had spilled out into the bag. The Ma Po Tofu itself wasn't what I was hoping for. The tofu was in big, hard-ish, dry-ish blocks, and the "spicy" sauce was runny, consisting of red and jalepeno peppers. The Fish Porridge was the same as it had been for my previous order: satisfactory. 

From these two experiences, I'd only re-order the porridge. I'm not confident the rest of the menu will "deliver" the experience I want.
author: Jennie Y.

description:
TL,DR: Below average food, but reliable. Terrible service. If you have time, do yourself a favor and go to the Mission instead. 

In terms of food, it's serviceable. They have a steam table out during lunch, from which you choose a base carb (fried rice, lo mein, and chow fun) and then pick 1, 2, or 3 hot sides to go with it. It's reliable in that the options don't vary much from day to day, and the food always tastes the same.

I can only give two stars because of the service--the first time I went I got the buffet lunch, which is supposed to include soup. When I asked the lady for soup, she grunted, "no soup today" without making any eye contact. I couldn't tell her I didn't want the meal anymore at that point, so I paid the full price.

I went two more times over a week and a half to test to see if there was any change--each time, the same lady told the same thing, "no soup today". Seriously--it wouldn't bother me HALF as much if she simply told me that they no longer serve soup. I hate being lied to by people who sell me food that will enter my body. Not to mention that the portions got consistently smaller.

Furthermore, I once ate my meal inside at a table because I was hungry--the same lady got a phone call and yelled "I GET YOU MONEY NEXT WEEK, NEXT WEEK" loud enough for all the customers to hear. She then sat down in a table (leaving the register alone), where she pouted and barked out shrieking complaints to her cooks.

Another bone to pick--if you go through the photographs, you'll notice that user "Daniel C." has some of the same pictures as those labeled as "from business owner", and even watermarked photos quite possibly taken fresh off the internet. I wouldn't be surprised if he's one of this lady's cronies. To top it all off, they've all been given insipid titles like "Great choice" and "Love it".

I don't go to a Chinese restaurant and expect royal treatment, but I do expect the standard for a normal dining experience to be met. If you're in a pinch, grab a buffet lunch but don't expect any soup. If you've got time, head down 24th until you get to the Mission, where you can get cheaper AND tastier food given to you by much more pleasant people.
author: Hungry P.

description:
What a good restaurant. Food tastes good and cheap. And there is a waitress standing around the bar with warm smile. 
I love the KungPao Chicken.
author: 文玺

description:
Excellent !!!
Ate general Tao chicken and beef chow fun 
Service was great and friendly
Really enjoyed!!!
author: Oliver W.

description: Delivery was pretty quick, which is why I gave the 2 stars. However from there the food was not good. The sweet and sower chicken was bland tasting and the meet was soggy. The fried wontons were not crispy instead were also soggy and not tasty. I would not deliver from here in the future.
author: Sergio S.

description: Never ever again. Soap bubbles in won ton soup. Hong Kong noodles too salty. The service was horrible they seemed to be lost. Not knowing which table ordered what.
author: Til B.

description: Avoid this place. The food is cold and old. I came with my son for lunch and the food is terrible. He picked this place I assume because he didn't want to wait on the food.   I couldn't eat my plate. It was nasty. I had the sesame chicken Fthey had on the hot table and it was hard . The chow fun had an earthy taste to it.  If was not a pleasant meal.
author: Claudia E.

description:
I like this place because they make delicious salt and pepper foods, my favorite are salt and pepper fish, salt and pepper shrimp, salt and pepper chicken. Yes, I love salt and pepper food. Also, the yang chow fried rice, my favorite combination fried rice in the world, is very good. I would recommend to my friends.

Now they are having promotion if you order online through grubhub.com, using the code: gg50144 to get 5 dollar off for your first time order. Great Deal!
author: Yu C.

description: My mom needed to use the bathroom and she lied and said there was no bathroom then right when my mom was going to the bathroom she lied and said a cleaning lady was in there, then a nice man pretended to be my moms life so she could use the bathroom but the lady said no so we left and that hungry man didn't get his dinner there. Terrible person and customer service. Be careful where you spend your money because it can go to bad people like her.
author: Nikan R.

description: I don't eat meat. I clearly specified and clarified that I wanted their orange "initiation" chicken from the menu. When I got the order, I ended up eating real meat but quickly realized that it was real. When I came back, they asked me what imitation chicken was. Very disappointed in the service. After much deliberation, they decided to mend my order.
author: Raakin H.

description:
Another disappointment in delivery cuisine.
General Chicken was horrible. Tasted like Lemon Chicken. 
Spicy Pork and Beef Chow Mien had meat that I believe was bad. 
The entire order went in the trash. The only positive thing was they made the delivery window by 4 minutes and the Hot and Sour Soup was not bad. 
Don't waste your money. There has to be a decent Chinese restaurant in SF, but I can't find it.
author: Richard L. D.

description: i ordered through GrubHub with special instructions to call from the door (my doorbell doesn't work). Instead I got a call from the delivery person that he wasn't able to deliver because "no one was home", "no one answered the door". I pointed out the special instructions, and he said he'd come back. One minute later he called again to tell me that the food was hanging on my door. HE TIED MY FOOD TO THE GATE OF MY BUILDING. Not only unsafe - I'll report back if my food was tampered with ;) - but also unprofessional. I'll never order again.
author: Dana C.

description: Alright, I was hesitant about trying this place but I ordered and here we are. I didn't get much so I'm giving it 2 stars - one star for the rangoons I ordered that were edible and the other for making it clear that I have only tried two things on this menu so I can't write it off entirely. The rangoons I got were yummy however it would have been nice if they were still warm... The delivery took so long that the restaurant was on the verge of closing when I put my order in at 9:50pm. Almost two hours. Along with my rangoons being cold, I also ordered the crab wontons and they were extremely hard and extremely cold and extremely extremely bare. I thought I was going to crack a tooth O_O .. like I said, I can't say much about the other food on the menu, but those two things were delivered poorly. I'm sure it would have tasted better if I had them fresh. My tip for others, don't do delivery, eat there. Seems like a great place to just stop and grab something quick.
author: Chelsea I.

description: This is not the restaurant I went to. It is the Golden Wok , in South San Francisco. They are a 5 star establishment.
author: Greg R.

description: Really great food at the place, the workers are very patient and polite. The place itself is has a great vibe, it's very organized, and very comforting. The food is delicious and the prices are even better. Love it!
author: Mario C.

description: Ordered delivery at 10 pm and the food came a little cold and I got dumplings with meat but they gave me vegetarian instead. Didn't even eat any of the food before I threw it away.
author: Gulraize K.

description: This is my favorite spot in San Francisco anything I had so far is amazing, kung pao Chicken is so good yummy, fresh food and also they do delivery :)
author: Val R.

description: Wok & Go has been my neighborhood Chinese restaurant for the last year that I have been living here. Over the past year I have gotten to know the amazing staff here. It has the best Chinese food in the neighborhood and I come here at least once a week! My favorite dish is the Beef with Ginger and onion!
author: Haochi C.

description: Just got some Chinese food from this place ，it tastes amazing,love the magnolia beef ,also the house chow mein taste awesome too ，will try to order for delivery next time.great place , highly recommend.
author: Shiu Shang Y.

description: Food is very delicious and very quick so much I like this place, I will come again soon.
author: Li C.

description: DO NOT GO HERE! Absolutely disgusting. Made a quick stop for some quick Chinese and made one of the worse decisions of my life. Very salty and can taste the over abundance of MSG! Felt sick after eating just a few bites.
author: Pablo H.

description:
I don't always like cheap Chinese food because it's usually too salty, too oily, and too Americanized for me. Well for some reason, I really liked the Chinese food here.  Weird because it was definitely well seasoned, greasy, and definitely Americanized. I was definitely hungry, and the food definitely hit the spot. Grease is what you need to delay your gastric emptying and decrease bring hungry and thus snacking before dinner.  I had the chow mein, curry chicken, and broccoli beef--classic Americanized Chinese food items. Cheap and tasty.  A bit oily but good Chinese food needs oil!

Wok and Go is The Panda Express of the Mission. The staff are all young, speak English, and are very polite and courteous. Since they knew I was Chinese (Do I look it?) when I asked for hot sauce, they asked if I wanted chili oil (la jiao you) or chili sauce (la jiao jiang).  Props to the guy cashier who differentiated the two and offered me a choice.

Plenty of SFGH patients, families, medical staff come here for lunch. It's across the streeet from Walgreens.  So while Walgreens takes forever to fill your prescription, why not go "wok n go" across the street to have some Chinese food!
author: Matthew L.

description: Good!!! Food is cheap but good.Like the waitress there, a young Chinese girl .She always wears smile.
author: YingShi Z.

description: Ordered from grubhub and delivery was on time. As far as the food, it was just ok, the honey walnut prawns were delicious but overpriced for a small amount. I also ordered chicken fried rice and lets just say the fried rice was just eggs, chicken, rice, and peas... This is the skimpiest fried rice I've encountered.... Where's the other veggies and the flavor?
author: Janay T.

description: This is the worst chinese food I have ever had.  The food was terrible.  The soup was inedible.  The fried rice wasn't even fresh.  They refused to listen when I asked for "sauce on the side."  I can't think of a place who's food is worse.  Even the moron that delivered my food had a hard time with getting to my door.  If anyone ever decides to order chinese food from this place I suggest going to the Safeway and picking up one of those frozen chinese entrees or perhaps going to the nearest gas station for a hot dog and nachos.
author: Brusko Z.

description:
Wok & Go. More like you need to Wok away from this place and Go.

I was desperate for cheap Chinese food one night and decided to give Wok & Go a go. How can you go wrong with Chinese, right?

Wrong.

I went in for take-out and it looked like the food had been sitting in the burners for god knows how long. So the girl behind the counter tried making me a deal she thought I couldn't refuse. 

Girl: "I can give you 3 item for price of 2." 
Me: "Um, why are you trying to sell me more food? I just want 2 items."
Girl: "It's a good deal."
Me: "Where does it say that? I can't find the sign..."
Girl: "No sign, but I'll give it to you. It's good deal."

One thought sprung to mind: Sketchballs. 

I went against my better judgment and ordered anyway. I was desperate and hungry. 

Oh and get this: So I asked her to give me half white rice and half chow mein as my side. I do this in every Panda Express style Chinese joint I go to. She said that she'd have to charge me extra for the chow mein. I'm like WHAT? You gave me a discount for 3 items and you can't even give me half and half? 

So I take it home and low and behold, the food was as nasty as I thought it would be. Stale, greasy, riddled with MSG and tough from being in the burners too long. 

Take heed, people. Wok away from this place and ne'er look back.

1.3 stars.
author: Angelo B.

description:
Love the bbq pork fried rice, full order for only $6.50 and best part of it all is that it's only a few blocks from where we live... so I know what's for dinner when we're feeling lazy.

I agree that its like a panda express but cheaper and clean inside.  Dont go there expecting too much, just same ol' greasy delicious chinese food.
author: Melody T.

description:
I have no idea how this place manages to stay open. It must be from people like me who walk in mistaking it for a real place to purchase food. I walked in at around 8pm on a Monday night to a hot line of about 6 entree choices-that's it. The woman at the register spoke practically no English, nor did she seem to be making a real effort to try and communicate with me. She had no idea what was on the menu, even though the board was right above her head. She tried to overcharge me twice, then couldn't work the credit card machine (I literally had to push the buttons for her from around the counter). 
While I tried to make the transaction a man complained that his fried rice was cold and hard- and it looked absolutely terrible and the woman did not care. She actually told him it wasn't her fault. My food (not sure what it was because it wasn't labeled and she couldn't tell me) was also cold and lacking flavor. I will never go in again.
author: Madison M.

description: the food is really good but doesn't come with rice. legit weird you have to order rice. we're obviously not in az anymore, no rice? some kind of sick joke.
author: Kimi G.

description: First the reviews for the food looking and tasting like Panda Express and not being or looking authentic,  it should be mentioned that mon-fri they serve buffet style food which looks similar to Panda.  The real magic is the weekend which they only do take out and delivery.  This place is amazing at cooking fresh and authentic Chinese.  I definitely would recommend the beef chow fun, the young chow fried rice, and the Hong Kong style chow mein.  This is probably the best I have eaten in a long time.  Give it a try on the weekend as it will not disappoint.
author: Rene C.

description: Food here is great! Not to mention very convenient. If you are in a hurry, they have it already made to go, or you can also order it off the menu as we'll. Just all the way around a win win situation!
author: Lindsay T.

description: Always come here when I'm in SFO visiting.   6.95 lunch specials says it all. Food is made to order and ingredients very fresh.  Served piping hot to your table.  The combination wonton soup is amazing!!  We absolutely love this place! No better place for the value!  We will definitely be back!
author: Emmanuel O.

description: fried rice was decent but generals chicken was INEDIBLE the chicken was the worst quality
author: Henry H.

description: The food in here is amazing!!!!!!, you guys must try the sesame chicken, Kung pao chicken and broccoli beef.
author: Kenny L.

description: I ordered delivery from here and the food arrived cold, soggy and it was the wrong order. I called and they said they would send the correct order and I never received it. Since I was at work I could not call them again. I will not order from here anymore.
author: Rikki C.

description: This restaurant is definitely a really good place for people who are working so busy and no time to eat! The food is better then all Chinese restaurant that i ever been! Come here and enjoy~
author: Natalia H.

description: That is a amazing restaurant. I ordered the Mongolian beef. That was so tasty. And the house fried rice was so fresh. The service is good. So nice to be there.
author: Nic Y.

description: I always go pass this place and decided to give it a try. This place is under new management.  The place overall is clean. I decide to get the three item combo. Got the chow mein, orange chicken and fried squids. Overall the food was good. The only negative thing about it was I found an orange peel inside the chow mein.
author: Chris Y.

description: Excellent!  You guys must try the sesame chicken and broccoli beef. I'll come again soon.
author: Cheng Y.

description: This place is Awesome!!!!! The food is fantastic! I love it soooooooooo much! The BBQ pork is taste soooo goooood
author: 智仁

description: The food and customer service was laughable... And I'm not even a picky eater!  Stear clear of this place unless you are having a diabetic episode!
author: Benjamin S.

description: Horrible place to eat even though I was hungry. I was about to go for check up in SFGH and to decided to try this restaurant before my appointment lunchtime. I only ate a portion of what I ordered because the food was tasteless.  I ended up having a headache after I left and I guessed because of MSG they added to the food. It happened to be expensive on my part.l The counter lady was mean.  I will never go back nor recommend this low class resto.
author: Margie M.

description: Delivery time was good. Food arrived smoking hot. Food was tasteful especially the Lemon Chicken. Will use for food again.
author: Irma M.

description: Literally the single worst Chinese food restaurant at which I have ever eaten. The food is disgusting. This comes from someone who secretly loves Panda Express and similar establishments. Also, it claims to be in its grand opening constantly, which is just downright false advertising
author: Aaron A.

description: We were told this lace was very good.  We are from LA. We mapped out bus directions as well as driving. Thank God we drove. The biggest dump ever. Did not eat there. Dry rice. Food looked like it had been there since last week.
author: Christine K.

description:
I don't know what it is about this place but it's clean as a whistle and the food is attractive.

The employees are super friendly and usually give me large portions with not one, but two fortune cookies. They
Are also happy to provide all the different sauces I can eat with my usual three course meal. 

If you haven't been, give it a chance, the prices are perfect and I give Wok &Go 5 STARS.
author: D F.

description: We ordered at 5:35pm, it arrived at 7:12pm. They are 2.1 miles from our place!  The driver called when he arrived. Sitting in the car across the street, and 2 min until I open the door looking for him he slowly open his door and cross the street to deliver. The food spilled everywhere in the bag. The chicken and corn soup had no chicken in it. The shrimps was not deveined. Gross and disappointed.
author: Angela L.

description:
I went here as a last result for my nephews birthday party it turned out not to be a bad choice!!! Thank God! 

The Chow mien was Great the Fried Rice Was Tasty, the kids Loved it the only thing that was a waste was the orange chicken it was dry and chewy not good at all it was the only thing leftover Real Bummer!!! Especially since it cost more than the rice and Chow M but...

Today I'll Be ordering the Pork Chow Mien Again For My Mamas Class I Hope Its Just as Great as before! 

So Yeah I'll Eat there Again The Place Is Clean The girl was nice and didn't mind explaining whatever we asked her, they said our food would be a wait of 25 minutes but we got our order sooner Big Plus!!!
author: Mychelle T.

description: This is by far my new favortie chinese resturant!!!! I haven't had anything bad here. And the salt & pepper fish is off the hook!!!
author: Monica B.

description:
The only thing I've had at Wok&Go that I like is their egg rolls. The pot stickers are okay, just a little soggy. The chow mien was bland and overcooked (mushy), and the curry chicken had an oddly thick sauce and was unappetizing. 

Walk the 3 blocks up to Punjab for majorly better Chinese.
author: Julie L.

description:
I think people are expecting too much of this place.  It's not much different from Panda Express.  It's just cheaper and good "fast-food" type of restaurant.  Each restaurant has caliber or "housing price range." This restaurant's housing price is on low price range.  

Depending on what you order, it's a hit or miss.  Mushroom chicken pretty good.  Noodles okay.  Just don't order the orange chicken.  Too orangy. I like the salt and pepper chicken and the fish is good.  It's definitely a lunchy thing.  

The people there are nice and most importantly, IT'S CLEAN! Do you know how hard it is to feel that a Chinese restaurant is clean?!?!  It's very clean.  Nothing is on the floor.  The bathroom doesn't make you want run out the door with tissue hanging by your feet because you're so scared to even do your business there. 

The restaurant is clean and good.  I liked it. There are times it is a hit or miss, but eh, it's good enough for me.
author: Jinny K.

description:
My rotation classmates and I came here hoping to get some good Chinese food and it didn't happen. We were looking for a place close to SFGH and this was the closest. J&E and Punjab weren't too far away but we were a little crunched for time. 

Typical chinese fast food. Too salty and too oily. For some reason I felt that Panda Express was even better. I'm sorry for this review. I'm biased b/c I'm part Chinese. "Ok place to go if you need to stuff yourself before drinking but not a place to go to actually eat." - anonymous. No wok & go, wok away.
author: Yumi H.

description: Service was bad. Order a plate of chicken and get 85% vegetables. Food was ok at best!
author: Oscar R.

description:
Wok and Go's steam table fare fills the void and makes a turd, but not much more, I'm afraid. The food was not spectacularly horrible or anything, but pretty much what you would expect from buffet-style Chinese fast food: cheap, fast and bland. 

The place is right around the corner from my house on Potrero, so I decided to give it a shot today while working from home. I picked up the Mongolian beef, sweet-and-sour pork, chow mien and some egg rolls. For the most part, it is just cheap grub that you mindlessly shove into your mouth hole so your tummy stops bothering you to eat. 

The chow mien was pretty tasteless and kind of pasty, the sweet-and-sour pork was pretty good with some Sriracha sauce on it, and the Mongolian beef was good enough. Again, nothing disgusting, fairly fresh, but pretty bland stuff. 

If you need to fill the hole in your gut and get the hell back to work, sure, I am not going to tell you to avoid the place. But if you want some decent Chinese food, you probably want to order off the take-out menu so it is cooked fresh or just go somewhere else.
author: Owen R.

description:
A "Panda-esque" style restaurant in the Potrero area. It looks like a family owned business. Nicely remodeled from an old gloomy Pizza place... a much needed face lift for the neighborhood. Definitely has a comfy feel to it.

Food was hot and delicious. Portions are huge! Prices are very reasonable... 
1 item combo for $5
2 item combo for $6
3 item combo for only $7... I was stuffed!

Service was fast and friendly... I walked in and looked around to see what they had... The girl behind the counter recommended a "few" items and after sampling the entire menu (Lol!) I ordered a 3 item combo with Chicken Chow Mein, Salt & Pepper Spareribs, Beef & Brocolli, and Eggplant. To my delight my stomach was full and I "Wok'd" away feeling satisfied with a great experience...

Definitely recommend and will come again! :)
author: Edmund W.

description: the food is nice .mongolian beef is tasty. I would order it next time.and the delivery is fast and convenient. everytime i order them .I would got the food fast.I love this restaurant.
author: Kings L.

description:
Just came back from Singapore and "of course" I feel the gap of quality for Chinese food but hey, not so bad. Other than that....no big deal.
Surely better than the close by J&E.
Not sure about the price point. Steamed rice and eggplants for $5?
Maybe I'm still thinking in Singapore dollars.....maybe.
author: Dario B.

description: Newly opened, quick, inexpensive, tasty, clean, family-run Chinese restaurant for eat-in or take out. Great variety. Great wings and house made eggrolls. (Get the meat egg rolls if they have them.  Handmade and they sell out.  Owner's mom's recipe... Yum.)
author: Kev M.

description:
I've been here once and look forward to coming back when I'm in the neighborhood. 

The server greeted me with a smile when I walked in.

The food is very fresh and tasty. I tried and loved the salt and pepper spareribs, beef & broccoli, and chow mein. 

The place is very new from the looks of it. Tables and bathroom was extremely clean and bright. 

My favorite part are the prices. Very reasonable for the amount of food you get. I asked if the shrimp entrees cost more and they said no! I'll have to try those next time.
author: Milly H.

description: Not very fresh-tasting and I felt like I needed a nap after.  Guess I should've expected that.
author: David P.

description: Today I ordered some of my favorites: sesame chicken, salt and pepper fish, and mongolian beef. I recommend all of those. Overall, the place is clean and the waiters there are nice. I recommend this restaurant to anyone. Great food!
author: Wendy Z.

description: Tried to order for delivery twice.  First time the driver was sick so no delivery.  Second time waited for an hour only to call and find out that they decided to close at 8 so wouldn't deliver.  What if I hadn't called?  Bad customer service.  If you aren't picking up, don't bother.  They don't deliver reliably.  Have no idea what the food is like because they have never shown up!  Never again.
author: David H.

description: If you aren't in the mood for Mexican food, at least there's this Panda Express-like food. I'm used to cheaper prices in Chinatown, but it's fairy decent. $5.50 get you two items and the food isn't that bad. I mean it's right in the middle. Some people will hate it because it's too greasy or not greasy enough. You kind of have to go in the mindset that it is Chinese food in the Mission. Other than that, get some stuff that is on the wall. Their chicken are pretty tender even though I came here in the evening and the people are super nice. I thinkt his place does well because of it's location. I mean when you're on the corner of two busy streets, of course you will have business.
author: Nam T.

description: Im going to rate this a 5, its chinese fast food, not gourmet, but for what it is, it all tasted fresh, and the place was extremely clean looking.  That is a huge plus in my book.  No fake dusty flowers, no dirty tables with half full sauce containers... its very nice looking, and there is a mirror you can see into the kitchen, that also looks clean.  A clean restaurant  serves clean food.... a plus in my book, and the price is reasonable!! good job Wok To Go!!! A welcome addition to san francisco's many dirty restaurants.....
author: wes t.

description:
We've ordered delivery from Wok & Go twice now and had great, fresh, delicious food both times. Most American Chinese junk food is pure oily salty limp old crap - but Wok & Go focus on fesh vegetables and the clean flavours found in actual Chinese cooking. The Chicken and cashew dish is fantastic, Vegetables Buddha style the same, salt and pepper prawns were a bit oily but they're deep-fried. My suggestion for delivery orders is to leave the foods that go limp when damp to the occasions that you visit an actual restaurant, such as mu shu - an go for veggies or veggies+meats dishes and you won't be disappointed by this place. I've not had an overly oily dish here yet. 1 star off for late deliveries by disinterested college students (but what can you do about that; it's everywhere). 

Highly recommended and our new definite go to for a Chinese junk food nosh-up.
author: Nick W.

description: I ordered Chinese broccoli in oyster sauce and a couple of other items for delivery and they gave me American broccoli, instead :(  When I called about it, they said they had run out and did give me credit for the next time I order from there.  I just am not sure if that's gonna happen.
author: Jaime A.

description: Got a 2 item lunch (fried rice, brocolli beef and salt n pepper ribs) . The fried rice taste good, the brocolli beef is alright but some pieces of salt n pepper ribs doesnt taste fresh. I know its not their seasoning and I could tell the difference. Place is clean and restroom is also clean. The young lady at the counter need to lighten up a little bit. A smile would not hurt.
author: roderick s.

description: I'm all for fast cheap chinese food, but when both staff people behind the counter are working away on their cell phones and the food is luke-warm, what's the upside? There are great other inexpensive Chinese food all over San Francisco ... this is not one of them. Too bad because I live right nearby.
author: laird A.

description: Took a $10 for $25 "coupon" purchased via Facebook (when Facebook was copying Groupon) here earlier this week, only to be told that stipulations not revealed by Facebook applied. I was permitted to get only ~$18 of the expected $25 worth of food. As for the food itself: large quantities were provided, but as I learned when I arrived home, 1/3 of the food I received was not what I ordered; and as suggested by several other reviewers, this isn't exactly the highest quality of Chinese food available.
author: Richard A.

description: Surprise! Thought I'd try this place just for fun. Clean, affordable, cool and hip...oh yeah the food is good too!
author: Carlos S.

description: I can get 3 items + rice for $4.00 in chinatown or go to  J& E's up the block and get Piles of food for that price and better quality . Sorry Wok & Go I'm gonna just Wok By !
author: Juan a.

description: If you're in the area and on a budget looking for some good food, this is the joint. I got there when they just opened in the morning so the food was very fresh and tasty, Wasn't expecting much but was overall impressed with the combo.
author: J C.

description: Was disappointed. Sweet and Sour Pork was mostly just sweet with tough spots of gristle or something. Fried rice was not impressive either. It all taste like it was frozen in a bag and then thawed under a heat lamp. I've had much better within the same price range at Ken's Chinese Kitchen and you get fantastic hot/sour soup on the side; rice; and a spring roll. Not to mention its also served to you rather then counter bought..  It's on the other side of town but worth the trip.
author: John W.

description: I go here all the time. Food taste fresh and delicious. The place is very clean and all the workers and owner are very nice.  Excellent place to go for Chinese food.  If you don't see anything you like on display you can custom order it. What more can you ask??
author: Gir G.

description: Watch out Panda Express, you have a new challenger in town!  I came by on the 2nd day of their grand opening.  And I have to say that the food is pretty darn good.  The place is nice & clean and gives it a little more of a modern look than your traditional chinese restaurant.  The last good thing to say about this place is that the prices are really cheap!  $7.00 for a 3 item plate.  I will surely be back there!
author: Steven T.

description: It's great at what it tries to do: tasty, inexpensive, fast Chinese food. Good go-to place when you have a craving. You've almost certainly had better, but you come here for the value and convenience.
author: Joseph Y.

description: Not that great. Especially the tofu, which was very spongy and bland.
author: Kay S.

description:
I went to this new restaurant hoping that I would have a new regular place to go to get good quick food. The steam trays full of meats and veggies looked delicious so I opted for a three item combo for $7.95. I got the chicken chow mein, broccoli shrimp, kung pao chicken and lemon chicken. The nice lady who served me even threw in a free chicken egg-flower soup. 

I walked three blocks home and opened up the compartment tray to share my goodies with my boyfriend. I tried the chow mein first, which was average. Then I sipped the soup, which was so bland I might as well have been sipping hot water, save for the chunks of egg and chicken. The lemon flavor on the lemon chicken tasted like lemon pudding (artificial) and the kung pao was very vinegary. The broccoli shrimp was ok.

But the food was cool by the time I got home. Which makes everything taste less appealing. I've carried home food from the same general area without this problem. I wonder if the steam table is warm enough.

I realize I came the second day of operation and know that there are many adjustments to be made. I may be giving this place another try in a month or so, and hopefully they've worked out the bugs in their recipes and equipment.

Until then, I'll stick to ordering delivery from Jamine Tea house when I want good Chinese food.
author: Megan C.

description: I gave this place only 1 star and I didn't even eat their food. Why? Because they refused to allow me to use my $25 voucher that I purchased months earlier on Facebook (a tiny logo in the corner identifies this as "KGB Deals via Facebook"). The expiration date of December 28, 2011 was clearly printed twice on this voucher, yet the woman at the restaurant refused to accept it. She said these vouchers all expired on December 23. When I protested, saying "how was I supposed to know that," she had no answer. She said the KGB person who sold them the deal won't answer their phone anymore. She then looked up the company web site and gave me two phone numbers: one in NYC and one in Bethlehem, PA. Of course, I got voicemail at both places since it was after 5pm EST. I left messages on both lines, but based on a number of online complaints I've read about KGB, I don't expect to hear back. The irony of this is that if I had been told this offer was expiring 5 days early, I could definitely have used it. After all, I've had it for months and they KNEW that I had purchased it. What a bad bad bad way to do business. Maybe this restaurant has gotten scammed by KGB, but that doesn't excuse their store personnel from offering something in exchange for my situation. Clearly, I wasn't the first person to have had this happen to. Even though I was hungry, I refused to give them any business!
author: Doug L.

description: it should be called wok and never come back , 2 stars for the cheap prices and cleanliness and friendly service, food didn't do it at all though :(
author: NAEL K.

description: Orange chicken was burnt, tasted horrible. Horrible chow mein and stale? fried rice. for this kind of food it was over priced. panda express is way better, and cheaper, than this place. don't waste your time, because i'm definitely not going here ever again. J&E all day every day!
author: Samantha J.

description: this place is yummy! the owner guy is so nice & the food gives me a home-cooked feeling. the mongolian beef is my favorite and their vegetarian fried rice (which i have ordered numerous times as a party platter) has a special taste to it that keeps me coming back for more
author: Boh Boh W.

description: When they first opened they had a nice variety of dishes for everyone, including veggie option. You now have to "special order" veggie and tofu options at about $8/9 bucks a pop. Sorry the food's and the portions are not worth that much. We've moved on . . .
author: Wendy R.

description: Think we found a new fav local chinese takeaway. Tasty food and fast delivery. We ordered the salt and pepper chicken wings, sweet and sour pork, chinese broccoli with oyster sauce all very good!
author: Charlie B.

description: We shared a HUGE plate of food, three entrees and a side for $7 and then the owner threw in some soup.  We liked it all, and unlike other Chinese places on 24th, the food was not greasy and it was really flavorful.  We'll go back. . .often I hope.  I do agree with other reviews that the food could be hotter.  The sesame chicken was delicious though.
author: Brenda B.

description: They refurbished the old Pappa Potrero location.  Nice clean restaurant.  Food was very fresh and tasty.  My only complaint is the serving line that they serve the food from needs to be adjusted so the food is hot rather than luke warm.  The opened today (3/18/11) .  Hopefully they can get the food served hotter.
author: Jim H.
